newsitem.title: USA: Intl Microcomputer names new CFO.
newsitem.headline: Intl Microcomputer names new CFO.

text.p: International Microcomputer Software Inc said on Thursday it named Kenneth Fineman chief financial officer and vice president of finance.
The company said Fineman was most recently president and chief executive officer of ActivCard Networks Inc where he founded its North American subsidiary.
The company said Fineman replaced Mark Cosmez, who was leaving to assume a new position elsewhere.

Prior to joining ActivCard Networks Inc, Fineman co-founded a subsidiary of Wasserstein Perella & Co where he executed asset-based mergers, acquisitions and related financings, the company said. Fineman also held positions at Bankers Trust Co and Arthur Andersen & Co.
International Microcomputer publishes productivity software for small business and home markets.
